meaning: harsh and cruel
examples_0: Giving someone a life sentence for stealing a loaf of bread is a draconian consequence.
examples_1: To many, capital punishment is a draconian practice.

meaning: a first version of something written or drawn
examples_0: Before I submit my final article, I need to edit my draft.
examples_1: The blueprint draft has been sketched but the official copy isn?t finished.

meaning: to pull someone or something often roughly and through or across an area
examples_0: The soccer players drag the heavy duffle bags into the locker room.
examples_1: Campers drag their sleeping bags and tents for miles through the thick forest until they reach their campground.

meaning: a police set-up put in place to catch a criminal
examples_0: Concealing his badge, the officer prepared the dragnet for the citywide drug sting.
examples_1: The law enforcement sting included a dragnet aimed at capturing human traffickers.

meaning: a British soldier mounted on horseback
examples_0: Training of the British dragoon included lessons in horse-riding as well as fighting while mounted.
examples_1: Grasping the Prussian flag, the British dragoon was able to defend himself while riding away from combat.

meaning: extreme or severe
examples_0: She was so brokenhearted after the breakup that she considered taking drastic measures to win him back.
examples_1: After he lost the game, his drastic reaction was to punch a wall.

meaning: an expression used when one wants to express irritation or annoyance
examples_0: ?Oh, drat!? Harriet exclaimed when she realized she had left her wallet at home.
examples_1: ?Double drat and darn it,? Claire complained after finding out she didn?t get the job.

meaning: a current of air
examples_0: Since Billy didn?t shut the glass door completely, his mom could feel a small draught.
examples_1: The old mansion was beautiful in architectural design, but the owners experienced discomfort due to the creaks and a cool draught felt in each room.

meaning: a disadvantage or downside
examples_0: The cruise to the Bahamas offered many perks, but the overall price was still a drawback.
examples_1: Selling the house included the drawback of having to find and hire a realtor.

meaning: a type of accent branded by slow and drawn out speaking that is usually related to the southern United States
examples_0: The old banjo player?s songs seemed to go on and on as he picked and sang along in a Southern drawl.
examples_1: ?Yawl come back now,? the woman called in a drawl that was as sugary as it was country.

meaning: showing wear from being overworked or not cared for
examples_0: The student?s once healthy face looked drawn after several late-night study sessions.
examples_1: Haggard and worn, the homeless man?s drawn appearance represented years of neglect.

meaning: a feeling of intense fear and anxiety
examples_0: The extremely shy speaker was filled with dread as she stepped in front of the microphone.
examples_1: Dread crept into the woman?s throat as she spotted a shadowy figure at the opposite end of the dark alley.

meaning: extremely terrible or awful
examples_0: The dreadful heat beat down on the farmhands, making their day?s work even more grueling.
examples_1: A dreadful noise filled the halls of the insane asylum as the patients cried out for help.

meaning: imagined or fantasized about something or someone
examples_0: The love-sick man dreamt about the day he would finally marry his true love.
examples_1: I had dreamt about winning the lottery but never thought it would actually happen.

meaning: cheerless, bleak, and dull
examples_0: The rainy weather was putting me in a dreary mood.
examples_1: After the death of my grandmother, I was in a dreary mood for weeks.

meaning: flimsy or cheaply made
examples_0: Bargain hunters are always looking for products that are low in price but not dreck or of low quality.
examples_1: Thinking she got a good deal, the shopper was upset to learn that the brush she purchased was dreck and broke quickly.

meaning: a huge, power shovel used to remove dirt and other debris from a channel or riverbed
examples_0: The workers used the dredge to remove sediment from the shallow sea.
examples_1: The channel was not navigable until a dredge was used to remove a large slab of concrete.

meaning: the least wanted parts or persons
examples_0: People who think homeless people are the dregs of society do not realize they could be down-and-out too.
examples_1: In the cafeteria the popular girls always sit far apart from the people they consider to be the school dregs.

meaning: to cover abundantly
examples_0: Everyone gasped as my little sister used ketchup to drench every piece of food on her plate.
examples_1: I watched in horror as the spewing liquid continued to drench every inch of the brand new carpet.

meaning: to fall asleep slowly
examples_0: I had just started to drift off to sleep when I heard the doorbell.

meaning: an underground prison, usually of a castle
examples_0: The king?s dank and chilly dungeon kept the most notorious offenders in the city.
examples_1: Without a dungeon to place the captive in, the soldiers took turns keeping watch of a makeshift cell.

meaning: a person's belongings, especially those brought on board ship
examples_0: Loading the dunnage on the ship was a tough job since the passenger had packed for a three month stay.
examples_1: There was minimal space for dunnage under the bus, so the passenger packed as much as she could in her carry-on bag.

meaning: a pair or couple, usually associated with one another
examples_0: Minnie and Mickey Mouse are the most famous duo in Disney history.
examples_1: The dynamic duo, Batman and Robin, worked together to defeat the criminals in Gotham City.

meaning: to deliberately mislead someone or the person who is easily used or tricked
examples_0: My brother is a schemer who is always trying to dupe people out of their money.
examples_1: Because Bill does whatever his friends tell him to do, he is the perfect dupe to act as a getaway driver.

meaning: a house divided into two separate apartments
examples_0: Both sides of the duplex are currently being rented.
examples_1: Aside from the wall in the middle, the duplex apartments shared everything.

meaning: an exact copy of an original
examples_0: The man?s duplicate license replaced the original that he lost.
examples_1: A duplicate copy of the infant?s birth certificate was requested by his parents.

meaning: dishonest behavior that is intended to trick someone
examples_0: Most politicians use duplicity to deceive voters just long enough to get their votes.
examples_1: Although the swindler used duplicity to trick his victims, he never physically harmed anyone.

meaning: able to stay in good condition, withstand wear and damage; strong
examples_0: The plate was made of durable plastic and didn?t break when accidentally dropped.
examples_1: The couple was searching for a durable car that would last years.

meaning: the time period in which something occurs
examples_0: The total duration of the film is 180 minutes.
examples_1: Our field trip ended early since the duration of the movie was much shorter than expected.

meaning: force or threats meant to make someone do something
examples_0: The judge overturned the case because the defendant?s attorney proved that his client?s confession had been given under duress.
examples_1: The vet said Scampi was licking her nose because she was stressed out, but I didn?t think she had been under any duress.

meaning: the darkest part of the evening
examples_0: The boy?s mother warned him that he must be back inside before the streetlights came on at dusk.
examples_1: I enjoyed watching the sunset go down, but left the park right before dusk.

meaning: responsible; devoted
examples_0: A dutiful daughter will care for her parents in times of difficulty.
examples_1: As a dutiful soldier, the man served his country with pride.

meaning: performing responsibilities as expected
examples_0: The Navy Seaman dutifully painted the ship gray as required by the military.
examples_1: Knowing how much he loves to eat, the wife dutifully cooked three meals a day.

meaning: a responsibility or obligation
examples_0: As an American, it is your duty to vote on Election Day.
examples_1: The lifeguard?s duty was to keep the swimmers safe.

meaning: a mythical creature that is short in stature
examples_0: Without a step stool, it was difficult for the dwarf to get anything done around the cabin.
examples_1: Each dwarf took a keen liking to Snow White.

meaning: to live in a specific place
examples_0: The migrant worker did not intend to dwell in the rural town for very long.
examples_1: There was no way for the homeowner to dwell the roach infested house.

meaning: a person who lives in a particular place
examples_0: The apartment manager offered the dweller a month of rent free living in exchange of a new lease signing.
examples_1: Without a dweller, the house was empty for several months.

meaning: a place where people live
examples_0: An adobe dwelling was made from dirt and other organic materials.
examples_1: Without materials to build a more stable dwelling, the natives settled on teepees.

meaning: an increase in the size of an area of a person?s body due to excess fluid
examples_0: Once the pain was too much to bear due to Kevin?s edema, he was admitted to the hospital to drain the water pooling under his skin.
examples_1: It became apparent that Sally might be suffering from edema considering her right hand was much larger than her left.
